subtitle.subtitle: That girl. Zoey. Let's take her.
[Agu speaking English] Our country is at war
and we are having no more school.
So we are having to be finding ways to be keeping busy.
And what am I gonna do with this, Agu?
It's a TV. I'm selling it.
This dirty thing with no screen?
-[in English] Please, I love you. -[Dike] I don't love you.
-Oh, please, I beg. -Don't follow me. Go!
[speaking native language] It's garbage. All of you go away!
It's an imagination TV! How can you say it's garbage?
[Agu speaking English] We are living in a buffer zone.
My father is saying, "Outside, people are suffering,
That is why so many refugees are coming here small-small.
[speaking English] Master, master, please, will you buy this TV?
How am I supposed to watch this?
The Nigerians are keeping the peace.
[Agu] They are always buying things, so they are easy to be selling to.
Okay. How much for this treasure?
Huh? Three thousand. Too much! Thousand five.
Oh, no, no, no, no. Thousand five.
-[Dike] Some food, some food. -Bring out some of your food and take it.
Uche, bring the foods and come.
[Agu] I am a good boy from a good family.
My mother is always working hard for us.
Who can tell me where lions live?
[Agu] I like my father more now that he's not my teacher.
[Agu] Since the war, he is a busy man.
He is using some of our land
so that the refugees can be making a new village.
[father speaking native language] What we need now is medicine.
He is more concerned with his muscles and his hair.
Sometimes I am adding to his soaps.
When I get a hold of you...
I was trying to make it warmer for you!
You're lucky I don't shit on you.
I'm gonna fart on your face.
[Agu speaking English] Big brother is also concerned with sleeping.
[speaking native language] I want to sleep with this girl before the war gets here.
[Agu] I am not liking his music.
[speaking native language] Let me go! I didn't do anything to deserve this!
I am not liking his dancing.
And how can that girl be sleeping if he is making so much noise?
[speaking native language] Let me go! I don't like this!
[pastor speaking native language] Treat your neighbor as your brother.
as your mother or older sister.
[Agu in English] My mother is always saying,
"If you do not know what to be doing,
you can always be asking God for the answer."
[pastor] Choir, give us a song and then we'll continue.
[Agu speaking English] God is liking music more than just talking.
So if you are singing and dancing, then he will be listening to us well-well.
[big brother in native language] Cut that branch.
Just hold on tight and cut it.
Have your lazy friend do it.
He's the driver. Cut that one.
If I was a taxi driver, I'd drive around it.
We've been working all day. Give us some money for our work.
Why did you block the road?
We are trying to fix it.
Curse yourself, standing in the middle of the road.
You stole my land! Me, an old woman!
The devil will bless you one by one!
The lights are on, but nobody is home.
[speaking native language] We saw that witch woman today.
The land we gave to the refugees...
has been in our family since before your grandfather.
I gave her a place, but she refused.
Who did this to my TV?
[speaking native language] If I acted like you when I was your age,
It's not luck, everybody loves me.
[big brother] Do you think she likes me?
When she sees these muscles, she'll fall in love with me.
[reporter speaking English on radio] It would seem things are changing quickly
As of this morning, the NRC junta moved to abolish all political parties,
further consolidating their control of the government
in the wake of the recent military coup.
commander-in-chief of the armed forces responsible for the junta,
stated in a recent press conference
that it was his intention to rid the southern regions of the PLF,
who he accused of being financed and supported by foreign institutions.
He also condemned the Native Defense Force militias,
who he said presented a threat to the very fabric of national security.
Sangania went on to promise that the junta would accomplish
what the previous regime had failed to do.
Speculation on the collaboration between the armed forces and the PLF rebels...
[Chief Priest speaking native language] The NRC broke the agreement.
Now they want us to run away and leave our town.
Our ancestors have lived here, taken care of it, and left it for us.
It's our duty to protect it...
and leave it for our children.
So we should send the women and little children away...
And we who call ourselves men will stay and protect our town.
Who is going to take care of the property we are leaving behind?
Let me go, it's my duty.
We will be crushed between the rebels and the army! It is so bad!
[father speaking native language] We've already decided
what to do with the children.
He is old. We can't take him anywhere.
You aren't listening to what I'm saying.
Go to your sister in the city, I'll meet you once everything is okay here.
You want me to be a refugee in my own country?
With three small children and no husband?
I'm not asking you, I'm telling you.
There are bigger issues to take care of--
He's sending you because you're a little baby.
Now turn it on and you'll feel better.
What kind of face is that?
Your face is like a monkey's butt.
[speaking native language] Come on! Come on! Come on! Hurry up!
Citizens of the republic, living in the buffer zone.
The National Reformation Council recommend non-combatants
to leave the buffer zone immediately...
This one's full. There's another here.
Is it heavy? Give it to me.
[man in English] Move back. Go back.
Please, please, I am the Section Chief. This is my family. There must be space.
This one woman and this small-small children.
[taxi driver] Where are you thinking this woman and child would be fitted?
They're gonna be sitting in the front with you.
No, no, no, no, no. Seventy thousand, no boy.
You wanting your woman to walk through the bush to the capital?
[speaking native language] I'd rather walk. I can't leave my child.
[speaking English] Please, how much to fit the boy?
-Seventy thousand, no boy. -[woman] Driver! Driver, driver!
Please, please, please. Hey, hey. With the boy!
I'll walk! I won't leave my child!
There's no other way! Get in!
Remember to pray to God everyday.
[father] You're with the men now, keep quiet.
[Agu speaking English] And this is how it is starting.
[speaking native language] Go take the clothes out of the rain.
[Agu speaking English] God, when I'm closing my eyes,
I am seeing the rainy season in my village.
You can be finding the ground is washing away beneath your feet.
Nothing is ever for sure... and everything is always changing.
Stay here. I'll call you when it's clear.
[father] Hey! Hey, hey! [shouting in native language]
[speaking native language] We need to go. If they catch us...
[man] If we run away now, they won't see us.
Be patient. The soldiers are outside.
If you talk, they'll find us. Keep quiet.
[soldier 1 speaking English] Turn around! Turn around!
[soldier 3] Y'all shut your mouth! [soldier 4] Shut your fuckin' mouth!
Which faction do you fight for?
[villager] No faction. [father] We are not fighters.
I am the Section Chief. We are trying to stop the looters.
-You are calling us looters. -[father] No. No. No, no, no.
-[in English] Do you know these men?
-[in English] Do you know these men? -Master, master, master, please. Please.
This woman, everybody knows she's crazy.
Master! Master, talk to her and you know that she's not right in the head.
They are not from here. They must be rebels.
We, the armed forces of the National Reformation Council,
find you all to be spies.
I sentence you to immediate and summary execution.
-I'm gonna kill you, man! -This is not the right place.
[soldier 3] I'm gonna kill you. [soldier 4] Fucking PLF!
[soldier 1] Hey, you! Keep your eyes down.
[soldier 2] Everybody move! Here comes the Commandant.
You get out of the fucking way!
What is this thing doing here?
Who is responsible for bringing this thing?
Strika, is it you that is bringing this thing?
So all of you grown men,
it is Strika, the small boy, that is finding this prisoner.
Two-I-C, what are we to be doing with this thing?
This thing? It is just a boy.
[Commandant] Does a boy have two eyes to see?
[Commandant] A boy has hands to strangle and fingers to pull triggers.
Why you saying a boy is nothing? Huh?
A boy is very, very dangerous. You understand me?
Are you wanting to be eating this thing?
Oh, you have hands like a baby.
If you are telling me, I will be helping you.
You see, Strika is hungry. He will eat you.
The government army killed my father... and my big brother...
and my father told me to run... into the bush.
Everybody here is calling me Commandant.
[soldier] How does the Commandant look? [all] All right, sir!
[soldier] How does the Commandant look? [all] All right, sir!
Now, what are they calling you?
Oh, you must say it like you are prouder!
that is what I will be calling you then, eh?
Leave this one under my charge. I will be training him to be a warrior.
So you can be fighting the army that is killing your father.
Is that what you want? You must be saying yes!
Rambo, give this SBU some work.
I saved your life. I saved your life.
Move it! Move it! Move it! Move it!
[soldier] How our Commandant look? [all] All right, sir!
You are now under NDF control.
If you're willing to stay, then stay.
[Two-I-C] They are not understanding me, boys.
Show them what I'm talking about.
-[man] Raise-- Put up your fucking hands!
-[man] Raise-- Put up your fucking hands! -Check them. Check them. Make sure...
This baby boy is your responsibility now. Train him.
Come over! Fucking move! Let's move. Move. Move.
-Please, can I have some of the food?
-Please, can I have some of the food? -[soldiers laughing]
You think you are soldier now, eh?
You's nothing. You're not doing nothing here.
You go back and stand on top of the chair.
I said go and stand on top of the chair!
[Commandant faintly] Two-I-C, go and call Strika to my house.
[Two-I-C] CO Hope! Send Strika to Commandant!
[Preacher] Where you go get this thing from?
[CO Hope] Two-I-C tell me to train this boy.
Show me position! Make sure you are clear. Move them, now!
You stay together! You stay together!
Close the space. You're too far.
Where are you looking at? Where are you looking? Eh?
[Agu] God... I want to be seeing my mother again.
Two-I-C is saying, small-small we are winning this war.
And then if you are willing, I can be finding her again.
[Two-I-C] The National Reformation Council took advantage of this instability
and militarily seized power to restore UPC dominance.
We NDF refuse to recognize this illegitimate government.
[Two-I-C] I said who are we? [all] We are NDF!
[Two-I-C] Our very own politicians, who steal our resources
and give them away for small-small dollar in exchange for private pay-offs,
they are spit on the constitution!
They are spit on your rights!
They are trying to spit on your future!
I say, who is your Supreme Commandant?
-I say, who do you fight for?
-I say, who do you fight for? -[all] Dada Goodblood!
[Two-I-C] In the battlefield, you not be thinking normally.
[Two-I-C] The only thing mattering is the mission of the NDF!
-Soldiers, are you hearing me? -[all] Yes, sir!
You fight and kill anyone who destroys the peace.
Offside, offside! That's what I saw. Offside, offside! Offside!
[Two-I-C] How does your Commandant look? [all] All right, sir!
-How does your Commandant look? -[all] All right, sir!
[Commandant] What is it that has brought this big family of strangers together?
We have to get revenge. Huh?
against the killings and rapings of our own people from the PLF
and now from the NRC junta.
But it has awakened a sleeping beast.
It has put the weapons of this war back in the hands of you,
the young and, therefore, the powerful.
We will not wait to inherit any wealth. Huh?
We will not wait for them to come and give it to us.
[Commandant] We are going to take it.
[Commandant] We are going to take it. [all] Yes, sir!
-We're going to take it from them.
-We're going to take it from them. -[all] Yes, sir!
All of you that have never been listened to before
and have seen your family killed, huh,
you now have something that stands for you.
You now have something that stands for you!
[Commandant] That is your family's blood. [all] Yes, sir!
-We are going to seize it! -[all] Victory!
[Commandant speaking English] The spirits have blessed you...
To the enemy, you are invincible.
But there are rules we must follow...
You are fortified! You are fortified, eh?
Now it is time for war. We are warring.
but from here we are moving.
Moving forward. We are not to stay here.
Don't be leaving anything for the enemy to be using.
We are going to burn it down.
-You are dismissed. -[soldier] Yes, sir. Thank you.
[Two-I-C] All of you, pack your weapons. Be ready to move.
[Commandant] Ah-ha! Make sure this thing is burned.
[Two-I-C] Don't make me be waiting for you, soldiers!
We are leaving nothing for them to find.
[Commandant] We are supplied and moving. Over.
Make sure all the guns are clean.
[Commandant] They have been buried for a long time.
This will keep the spirit up, despite the UN embargo.
[Goodblood] Our fight is a just one.
Being a freedom fighter is discipline, obedience and loyalty.
We remain ever loyal to Supreme HQ, sir.
Standing by for future orders. Over.
[Goodblood] Keep moving. Keep fighting. Over and out.
This here. This is the route where we are now.
Listen. From here, we must go down.
And wait by that road there.
Because I think something is coming across there.
[Preacher] Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey! Agu! Agu!
Hey! Why? Where do you go? Come over! Fuck! Fly!
[CO Hope] Preacher, give me the ganja.
[CO Hope] Agu, you know, ambush rule number one, no noise.
You keep quiet. Keep very quiet.
If even a snake bite your legs, you keep quiet.
You get hit, you keep quiet.
What is the rule number one in ambush?
No talking, even if snake is biting you.
You talk, enemies come around, we all go die.
They are coming. Everybody, be quiet. They are coming.
[soldier] Hey, you! Go! Cut them off!
Search this vehicle. Search all the vehicles.
I want this victory mapped. Map them. Map this victory.
This vehicle, all the bodies, I want them pockets searched.
All of it! Search them good-good.
Go and bring me my charge.
-Sir! I find this. -Why don't you open it?
Agu, you are going to kill this man.
[man stammers] Please. I'm supposed to be fixing the bridges.
You are going to kill him today.
[man] I not be a soldier. Please, sir.
I'm an engineering student from the university in the capital.
I'm supposed to be fixing the bridges,
Pass me something for this guy.
-Nah, that's too big. -It will be cutlass.
Does he have strength for this?
Yeah, he is strong. You can do it. Preacher, put him on his ass.
-[man sobbing] -Put him on his ass! On his ass!
So when you are chopping wood, lift up high-high. Up, high.
Then when you are ready, you come down so well-well into the flesh.
-You have chopped melon before? Melon? -Please, no.
-Well, this is not a melon. -Please, no.
I said shut your mouth, huh? Shut your mouth.
You are making it hard. This is hard.
It's hard, so you must split him good.
Huh? Agu, these are the ones that killed your father.
[Commandant] These are the ones, the dogs that kill your father.
[Commandant] Agu, these are the ones that killed your father!
That is what you call justice. Hmm.
[Agu] God... I have killed a man.
it is the right thing to be doing.
This will be the Commandant's car.
Take this fucker out. He is filthy.
Give this to my charge. Huh?
-This will be the Commandant's car. -Yes, sir.
[Two-I-C] If you are losing it, then I am losing you.
-You are driving? -[Two-I-C] Okay to move out.
Everyone, get ready to move out.
You got this stuff from where?
Hey, I'm asking you a question, and you are not talking.
I am thinking about my mom...
I am asking a question. You are not talking.
[boy 1] Where is he? [boy 2] Keep going, keep going.
[boy 3] Grass cutter! Grass cutter! Grass cutter!
[Commandant] And you're having any food that you want,
from chicken, cow, fruit and vegetable...
Any kind of fish that you want, we got. The fisherman is bringing it from the sea.
There's nothing you cannot have there.
And the best thing of this place, this town of abundant resources,
Hey, the women are too beautiful there! Too beautiful.
Ah! The next thing you know, your soldier will be standing to attention.
They are having bottoms with specifications so nice
that the ground where they're sitting down is also rejoicing.
And they know... they know how to be treating a man.
How to make him feel good, kisses and all that, huh?
Last time I was there, my soldier was hurting.
But you will see because you are going there yourselves.
You will see with your own eyes, gentlemen.
-Who is this? -Refugees from the village, sir.
They said the PLF and the NRC took their village three days ago.
They killed most of the town, but they let these ones go.
Well, let us be giving their village back, huh?
Uh, we are facing heavy fire, sir. Over.
It's very difficult, sir. Men are fighting bravely,
but I don't know if we can hold too much longer. Over.
[Commandant] Press on! [Two-I-C] Roger. We need support, sir.
Some of our men are injured.
The men's spirits are low. Sir, do you copy?
Copy, sir. We will reapply pressure and push for the bridge. Over.
See this thing, huh? This is a very special device.
We can be seeing the enemy even when the enemy is hiding.
Ah! There you go. See our guys. Look, we are taking them.
We want to take that bridge.
Now we are going to take that bridge.
[Commandant] That bridge, we are taking it!
[Commandant] Better look me in the eyes, motherfucker.
-Are you ready to fight? -[all] Yes, sir!
-Are you ready to fight? -[all] Yes, sir!
-You want to take that bridge? -[all] Yes, sir!
-We're gonna take that fucking bridge? -[all] Yes, sir!
[singing call and response in native language]
-[shouting in English] No retreat! -[all yelling] No surrender!
[Preacher] Our Father, from dust we were created.
We shall go back to dust.
[Two-I-C] I commit my fellow soldiers into your hands.
May their soul rest in peace. Amen.
[Agu] I am now knowing the smell of the dead.
And when they stay in the sun, they are growing plump like brown mangoes.
[Goodblood on radio] You have your next mission. Stand by.
[Goodblood] Capture the central regions, capital city, Bov.
I will promulgate an order making you Brigadier General.
You'll be a general before we finally seize the capital city.
[Commandant] Yes, sir. It is a challenge, sir.
But I promise you, it's mission possible. Over.
[Goodblood] Well, then, next time I see you,
I'll be speaking to a general.
And how is your Two-I-C performing? Over.
Two-I-C? Sorry, sir. What do you mean "Two-I-C"?
[Goodblood] I've always rated that young man.
Well, Two-I-C is a formidable soldier.
[Goodblood] Teach him the ways of a good commander.
[Goodblood] Now, take Bov. Keep that spirit up,
and bring us closer to victory.
[Goodblood] You want to be a general, don't you, Commandant?
-Agu, you fought well today. -Thank you, sir.
Agu, you are wanting to be knowing how to be leading?
-I am happy to be following you, sir.
-I am happy to be following you, sir. -That is good,
because there is no learning how to be leading.
Some people are born to be leaders, others are born to be followers,
and others are just waiting to be dying.
-I'm a good follower, sir. -Agu, you are different.
You are reminding me of when I was a small boy.
That is how I know you are going to be a leader.
You see, even the best leader
sometimes he must be knowing how to be a follower.
I am following the Supreme Commandant, even if I am not agreeing.
Yes, sir. I'm a good follower.
The Commandant is saying we must take this.
So, hmm, if it is important to him, it is important to me.
Because if we get that, then we can go to Taro.
-That is where your mother is, eh?
-That is where your mother is, eh? -She is in the capital.
After we've been greeted by Dada Goodblood,
we'll be taking the capital certainly.
You see, I've been wanting to help you more than the others, Agu,
but you cannot be telling the others how I'm helping you like this.
It'll have to be our secret.
-You are knowing how to keep secret?
-You are knowing how to keep secret? -Yes, sir.
-Well, be saying it. -I can be keeping this secret, sir.
I'm not punishing you, Agu. Mmm?
But I do care for you.
Be doing this thing... for me.
-[chickens clucking] -[boy 1] They are jumping like rabbits.
-Go, go. Keep going. -[boy 1] Go. Keep going.
I don't want that I call you and you just stand there. Agu?
Come here, I'll give you some brown-brown.
It'll cure everything for you, eh.
Hey, I didn't call you to stand there.
My boy, what is wrong with you? What is wrong with you?
Come here, I'll give you some morale booster.
I think I'll give you that brown-brown, so...
Morale booster, you know. Come, come. Here.
[Commandant] Nobody is your friend where we are going.
They are the farmers that have fed the enemy.
-The farmers' wives whose breasts... -[Preacher] Agu. Agu.
[Commandant] That is the nature of the land that we are going.
Our people's blood has been flowing for years.
That's why it is time for their blood to flow.
because they are all enemy, all of them!
He is guiding us with what we are about to be doing.
God, we will be sacrificing our blood!
That is why we must spare nobody!
Because we are invincible. We are invincible!
[Commandant shouting in English] NDF, spare nobody!
Come on, move, NDF! Move, move! Move!
[soldier] How the Commandant look? [all] All right, sir!
-I say, how the Commandant look? -[all] All right, sir!
-How the Commandant look? -[all] All right, sir!
-I say, how the Commandant look? -[all] All right, sir!
Leave this one under my charge.
I will be training him to be a warrior.
[CO Hope in English] Move, move! Move, move, move! Move!
-Out, out. Over here. -[woman and little girl screaming]
Fucking out! Out! Get up! Get up, fuck! Get up! Up!
[CO Hope speaking English] What the fuck going on here?
[speaking native language] I was looking for you!
[CO Hope speaking English] Where do you know this woman from? You know her?
[speaking native language] I was looking for you!
-[girl screaming] -[CO Hope] I wanna rape her!
[speaking native language] You're not my mother!
You're not my mother! You fooled me!
[Agu in English] God... are you watching what we are doing?
You didn't fucking boy, eh? You didn't fucking, boy.
Fuck him up, eh? Fuck you up. Fuck you up.
[soldier] Commandant, sir. This is for you, sir.
[Two-I-C] From the Supreme Commander. What does it say?
Now it is your turn to eat.
What is happening to this one?
A piece of RPG is hitting his temple.
[woman] I beg you, please, don't shoot me! Please!
-[soldier] Hey, keep your eyes down! -[Commandant] Oi! Oi! Oi!
[Two-I-C] What do we do with the civilians?
Send him up north to the next village and then the next village after that.
Tell them that we are coming. It's only the beginning.
Take note and act accordingly. Strika and Agu are now part of my squad.
[soldier] We are proceeding to Taro with arms. Over!
[guard and NDF chanting in native language]
What kind of welcome is this?
Sorry, sir. You, get in that car. Take them to HQ.
Right this way. Right this way.
Weapons are not allowed in here. So you place them here.
You wait here. Here. Have a seat.
And you will bring us water?
Goodblood says this is a token of appreciation--
I'm sorry. The Supreme Commander is so very upset to keep you waiting.
-What is this? -He'll be with you shortly.
I would like you to know we also offered rations and water
to the rest of your battalion this morning.
It looks like your family has grown.
They must eat while we talk, unless you are hungry, too.
I'm not hungry. Two-I-C, take them and go and eat.
[Preacher] Lot of food over here. Let's eat, man!
You are leading me to believe we are changing objectives.
Are we not taking the capital anymore?
Chief, to protect our people, the time is now.
If we have the momentum and we have the power, why wait?
You are not the political voice of this movement, Commandant. I am.
Protecting our people remains the priority.
But as you know, the world is becoming aware of this war now.
No one will escape judgment when it is over.
And the decisions we make have far deeper consequences.
And what decisions have you made... for my battalion?
Are you not making me general?
I'm giving your battalion to Two-I-C, Commandant.
That is why I brought you here.
And you, I will promote to Deputy Chief of Security,
I hope you accept and act accordingly.
Thank you, sir. I promise to fulfill my duty to the fullest--
This, my battalion... that I have made with my own hands.
Your battalion is my battalion, Commandant,
as are hundreds of others across this nation.
I want the ceremony of changeover tomorrow,
so that Two-I-C can take the battalion back out for battle.
As you know, and with thanks to you, we have the NRC on their heels
with the help and support of the UN and ECOMOD.
It has now become a battle for public image.
And what of my payment? Hmm?
What share of the resources will I be seeing?
Do not forget you are a soldier.
Your most important duty is obedience.
Your third duty is obedience. Everything is obedience.
I will have one more night... with my men.
Assemble the COs and the troops and bivouac outside of town.
I'm taking Two-I-C and the boys to all celebrate tonight.
And if you and Strika are my bodyguards, and I am going, then you are also going.
[Commandant] Yeah, make 'em bring something for my soldiers.
Bring beer. Bring soda. Bring whatever you have.
Can't you see we have guests? Hurry!
because we will drink it whether it's hot or it's cold.
I need to be checking on the others--
You will be staying here so we can celebrate you.
In fact, Mama, I want you to bring a special one for my Two-I-C,
who will soon be the Commandant.
[Commandant] Hmm. But you have one special for Two-I-C.
Hey, Mama, this one has fresh papaya.
If it is women you wanting, I get plenty from backyard.
Just bring me my own. You know my specifications.
See this little yeah-yeah boy born yesterday.
[Commandant] Don't mind him. Don't mind him.
-Where are the girls? -[Madam] They are coming.
We've got enough girls for the men, but no more for the little boys.
Look at you. Look at you.
[Commandant] You are looking very hot. [woman] Yeah, I miss you.
Don't be watching your Commandant because you can't have what I'm having.
What happened to my man? What happened here?
I was just playing with his gun and it just went off.
-I don't know what happened. I'm sorry.
-I don't know what happened. I'm sorry. -[Two-I-C] You did this.
You did this! You did this!
-You thought you were shooting me! -No, no, no!
-You thought it was me? -I didn't mean to. I'm so sorry.
Were you trying to kill me and you kill my soldier?
It was an accident! No! Not me--
Pick him up! Pick him up! Let's go! Let's go! Let's go!
Pick him up! I want you to take all their women!

why are you shining on this world?
